Ingredients.4: 1 tablespoon pickling spice, or to taste

Ingredients.6: 1 (7 pound) fresh, bone-in pork shoulder (picnic) arm roast, with the skin still on

Directions.1: Place kosher salt, brown sugar, pink salt, and pickling spice in a container large enough to hold brine and ham.

Directions.2: Bring 2 quarts water to a boil and pour over brine ingredients; whisk to dissolve. Pour in 1 gallon fresh cold water to cool down mixture.

Directions.3: Score the skin side of pork roast with a sharp knife, cutting into the fat beneath the skin but not into the meat. Score about 1 inch apart, then score in the opposite direction to get a classic diamond-shaped pattern.

Directions.4: Lower roast into brine, skin-side up. Use a plate to weigh down roast, so it cures fully submerged in liquid. Refrigerate for 1 day for every 2 pounds of pork (cure for 2 1/2 days for a 7-pound roast). Turn roast over halfway through the brining process.

Directions.5: Remove roast from brining liquid. Discard brining liquid and transfer roast back to the brining container. Cover roast with fresh cold water to rinse off salt; let soak for a few minutes to overnight, depending on how salty you want your ham. Remove roast from water and blot dry with paper towels.

Directions.6: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

Directions.7: Add 1 cup water and 2 whole star anise to a roasting pan. Place roast on a rack in the roasting pan.

Directions.8: Roast in the preheated oven until ham reaches an internal temperature of 130 to 135 degrees F (55 to 58 degrees C), about 2 hours. Ham will not be fully cooked at this point. If water has nearly evaporated, add a splash more.

Directions.9: Increase oven temperature to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Continue to roast ham until the skin is browned and crispy and the internal temperature reaches 145 to 150 degrees F (63 to 66 degrees C).

Directions.10: Make optional glaze: Mix mustard, maple syrup, cayenne pepper, and salt together in a bowl. Brush glaze on baked ham. Return roast to the oven for 5 minutes.
